data.title: How Cheap Can Fender Get???
data.meta_description: Used guitars, guitar setups, guitar repairs for the Tampa, St Pete, Clearwater, Pinellas and Pasco areas. I sell only carefully selected, thoroughly checked out and professionally setup guitars.
data.text:
I don‚Äôt have much time this morning, so I chose a guitar that looked like it wouldn‚Äôt need very much work. But it seems it‚Äôs always those innocent looking guitars that bite the hardest! Read on to learn how badly Fender cuts corners on these..

(Now keep in mind, I buy these off Craigslist, Marketplace, etc. just like everyone else, so this is a glimpse of what you‚Äôre likely to run into when buying used guitars..)

The only thing that stood out at first was that the G-string was loose. I tuned up the strings and took my measurements ‚Äì

Nut slot heights were ok ‚Äì about 0.015 inch ‚Äì much better than usual. Relief was a whopping 0.035‚Ä≥, but the 3/16‚Ä≥ truss nut was good and I brought it down to just barely under 0.015‚Ä≥ and there was plenty of movement left for future adjustments.

String height was almost off the chart at skyscraper level ‚Äì 0.140‚Ä≥+ But the neck angle and threads on saddle screws show that there is lots of room for adjustment, so I‚Äôll do that later with the new strings.

After removing strings, I checked each fret for level end-to-end (E to G) and found four high fret ends ‚Äì all under the G string, which would have caused buzzing for many players. Maybe that was why the action was set so high?

I used 600 grit sandpaper and brought those high frets down and rechecked to be sure they were level and that I‚Äôd preserved the crown.

Remember that loose G-string? It was loose because the tuner key had come loose. The tuner key came loose because it was held with just 2 screws. And why just 2 screws? Well, it seems Squier felt they could save a few more pennies this way!

They hid their misdeed by using fake screws to cover the other two holes in each tuner key! Can you believe that???

I agree that Squier generally offers a lot of bang for the buck and is a good choice not just for beginners but for any player on a budget. But I‚Äôve argued for years that many other companies offerings are just as good and often better. I couldn‚Äôt ask for a clearer illustration than these photos!

I‚Äôve never seen a Jay Turser, Silvertone, Washburn or Harmony cut corners this bad. It seems that only the biggest marketers ‚Äì Fender‚Äôs Squier and Gibson‚Äôs Epiphone can get away with tricks like this and their customers don‚Äôt seem to complain that much.

Naturally, I‚Äôm removing all the tuners and drilling two extra holes for each and screwing each tuner key in with four screws, because I only sell good guitars! üôÇ

The strap buttons were screwed in tight and securely, but two of the bridge screws had stripped in the soft wood of the body, so I‚Äôm reinforcing those with specialized hardwood shims otherwise known as ‚Äútoothpicks‚Äù üôÇ and Titebond. While the bridge and saddles are off, I‚Äôll dump them into my hydrosonic jewelry cleaner for a super-cleaning. Check out the bottom photo to see how shiny and clean they come out.

Someone had already dressed the fret ends and they did a good job. Neck angle was good; pickup heights were good/ jack was tight and everything else checked out ok.

I found some knobs for the controls, then cleaned the fretboard. First time over the fretboard was with naptha and 0000 steel wool. Photo shows second time through with naptha and a paper towel. Third time was fretboard conditioner.

If you use steel wool to clean your frets and fretboard, be sure and tape your pickups to protect from bits of steel wool being attracted to the magnetic poles. I wipe the filings off the fretboard with a paper towel, then collect the rest with a strong magnet before removing the tape.

I found one more example of Squier‚Äôs cheapness ‚Äì cheap screws. The screw that held the string guide had broken in half so only the top half of the screw was holding it. When I tuned the strings, it popped off! So I drilled a new hole a bit below the old one and used a new screw.
